title: Walk around Silsden - Reservoir and Country Walking Route

images.title: Memorial garden, Silsden by Humphrey Bolton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Memorial garden

images.title: Silsden Beck - Clog Bridge by Betty Longbottom, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Silsden Beck

images.title: Pastures beside Silsden Reservoir by Chris Heaton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pastures beside Silsden Reservoir

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Silsden Reservoir
images.caption: Silsden Reservoir. As seen from Bolton Road (A6034). This was a Bradford CWW reservoir, according to a 1" map of 1935. There appear to be a few houses at the left of the photo, and further left (south) is a covered reservoir, presumably the service reservoir for Silsden.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Great Gill Beck, Silsden
images.caption: Great Gill Beck north of the town. To the right is a 'window' through the trees into the brighter field behind.

images.title: Narrowing in the canal at Silsden by Andrew Abbott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Narrowing in the canal at Silsden

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Valley below Hay Hills Farm, Silsden
images.caption: Valley below Hay Hills Farm. There is a group of tall holly trees on the left. As usual, the stream is flanked by trees. Alongside it is a level area, and then a steep bank on the right. Black Hill is in the distance.

images.title: Betty Longbottom / Playing Field - Dale View
images.caption: Playing Field in the town with hills behind.

description: This West Yorkshire town is positioned on the River Aire and Leeds and Liverpool Canal near Skipton and Keighley. This circular walk around the town heads through the countryside around Silsden Reservoir to the north of the settlement. The walk starts on the eastern side of the town where you can pick up the Bradford Millennium Way. Follow the waymarked footpath north and it will take you towards Silsden Moor and Dales Bank Farm. Here you head east to cross the Great Gill Beck before turning south towards Swartha. Near here you pick up the Millennium Way again and head west back to the town. You can extend the walk by continuing south to pick up the Leeds and Liverpool Canal and enjoy a waterside stroll through the town.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Kings Arms is a friendly pub with a good selection of real ales. You can find them on Bolton Road at postcode BD20 0JY for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The country trails make for a fine dog walk and the Kings Arms mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the east you can pick up the circular Ilkley to Addingham Walk and enjoy a walk along the River Wharfe. To the west there's Sutton in Craven where you can enjoy a climb to Lund's Tower and Wainman's Pinnacle. Known locally as the Salt and Pepper Pots there's fine views over the area from the elevated position of the monuments. For more walking ideas in the area see the Yorkshire Dales Walks page.

display_address: Hawber Cote Lane, Brunthwaite, Silsden, Bradford, West Yorkshire, England, BD20 0JH, United Kingdom
